intro: Hypericum geminiflorum subsp. geminiflorum, commonly known as the twin-flower St. John's wort, is a shrub native to the western United States. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers in clusters of two, which give it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ornamental plant in native gardens.
